title: Syllabus mentioned in ERP
text: Objectives: This course aims to provide an in-depth understanding of railway track engineering concepts including track component and system design, construction, evaluation, maintenance, load distribution, wheel–rail interaction, track layout and geometry. Credit: {(3-1-0) 4 credits}Syllabus: Introduction; Wheel-Rail interface; Curves and Gradients; Track Loads; Static Track Design; Dynamic Track Design; Track Stability; Ballasted Track; Slab Track; Switches and Crossings; High Speed Tracks; Track Maintenance, Testing and Acceptance; Inspection and Detection SystemsTeachers: Profs. K. S. Reddy, M. Amarnath Reddy, K. P. Biligiri, Sujit Dash, Nirjhar Dhang, Arghya DebReferences: Railway Track Engineering, J. S. Mundrey, Tata-McGraw Hill Indian Railways Permanent Way Manual, Government of India, Ministry of Railways Modern Railway Track, Coenraad Esveld, MRT Productions Railroad Engineering, William F. Hay, John Wiley
